It is built upon the belief that the arrangement of Surahs in the recitation context which is between the two covers of the Mushaf upon which the whole Ummah is, is a manifestation of its rhetorical miraculousness, and that its miraculous proportion is not restricted to the proportion of its Compositional Order represented in the building of the sentence, but is also realized to perfection in its Ordinal Order represented in the relationships of sentences to each other in building the passage, the relationships of passages to each other in building the Surah, and the relationships of Surahs to each other in building the entire Great Qur'anic statement opening with Surah "Al-Fatihah" and concluding with Surah "An-Nas". *** Critique of the view that the arrangement of Surahs is Ijtihad. "Al-Biqa'i" declares in the opening of his interpretation of Surah "Al-Imran" the opinion of "Abu al-Hasan al-Haralli" represented in that the arrangement of some Surahs as it is before us between the two covers of the Mushaf is a Tawfiq (Divinely ordained/guided): "Al-Haralli said, pointing to the correct opinion regarding the arrangement of Surahs that it is by the Ijtihad of the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, as a confirmation by Allah Almighty for this organization and Surah arrangement in the established text of this Book: it is what Allah Almighty was pleased with and confirmed..." (1). Al-Biqa'i, as you see here, declares the correctness of the saying that the arrangement of Surahs is by the Ijtihad of the Companions. Perhaps Al-Haralli and Al-Biqa'i after him, and a group of scholars before them, in their going to the saying of Ijtihad from the Companions in arranging some Surahs, their resort or proof is what was narrated from the Hadith of "Yazid al-Farisi" from "Ibn Abbas", may Allah be pleased with them.

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: Narrated by "At-Tirmidhi", may Allah be pleased with him: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Bashar, narrated to us Yahya bin Sa'id and Muhammad bin Ja'far and Ibn Abi Adi and Sahl bin Yusuf, they said narrated to us Awf bin Abi Jamilah, narrated to us Yazid al-Farisi, narrated to us Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, said: I said to Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him: What made you proceed to Al-Anfal which is from the Mathani and to Bara'ah which is from the Mi'un, so you joined them and did not write the line {In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful} between them and placed them in the Seven Long Ones? What made you do that? "Uthman", may Allah be pleased with him, said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, used to have time pass upon him while Surahs with numbers [of verses] were being revealed to him. So when something was revealed to him, he would call some of those who used to write and say: Put these verses in the Surah in which such and such is mentioned. And if a verse was revealed to him, he would say: Put this verse in the Surah in which such and such is mentioned. Al-Anfal was among the first of what was revealed in Medina, and Bara'ah was from the last of the Qur'an, and its story was similar to its story, so I thought it was part of it. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, died and did not clarify to us that it was part of it. So for that reason, I joined them and did not write the line {In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful} between them, and placed them in the Seven Long Ones." Abu Isa said this is a Hasan Hadith... We do not know it except from the Hadith of Awf from Yazid al-Farisi from Ibn Abbas. Yazid al-Farisi narrated other than this Hadith from Ibn Abbas. It is said he is Yazid bin Hormuz. Yazid al-Raqashi is Yazid bin Aban al-Raqashi and he did not meet Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him; he only narrated from Anas bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him. Both are from the people of Basra, and Yazid al-Farisi is older than Yazid al-Raqashi. (Al-Jami' as-Sahih by Abu Isa At-Tirmidhi: Book: Interpretation of the Qur'an - Surah At-Tawbah - Hadith: 3086). This has a penetrating observation:

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: The Hadith was narrated by "Ahmad", may Allah be pleased with him, in his Musnad and "At-Tirmidhi", may Allah be pleased with him, in his Jami' as-Sahih from "Yazid al-Farisi" alone. "Al-Bukhari", may Allah be pleased with him, mentioned this "Yazid al-Farisi" in Ad-Du'afa (The Weak Narrators), and he is, as you see, uncertain in his name and lineage (1). So if this is the state of the one who was unique in narrating this Hadith, how can it be thought that it can be accepted regarding what is in it, especially in a matter related to the delivery of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace? How can a calculator calculate that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, could leave informing the Companions of something from the Holy Qur'an, even if that thing was regarding the arrangement of the Qur'an's Surahs? Indeed, in inferring with this Hadith, there is what does not reassure one to say it or prefer what is in it or assume it. I am not rejecting this inference because it is an inference by a Ahad Hadith, but because its narrator: "Yazid al-Farisi" is not of that standing, and if he were of status with the Imams, we would be the first to submit. The strange thing is that "Al-Haralli" says in the opinion I mentioned to you before "that it is by the Ijtihad of the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, as a confirmation by Allah Almighty for this organization and Surah arrangement..." So we do not know how that confirmation was? And what is the reason that Allah Almighty leaves such a thing to His servants even if they were Companions of His Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace?
foot_note: 1. (1) - The scholar "Ahmad Muhammad Shakir" goes in his commentary on the Musnad of Imam Ahmad to say that the Hadith of Yazid al-Farisi is very weak, rather has no basis. He mentioned what appeared in some copies of "At-Tirmidhi" that it is Hasan Sahih, saying the word "Sahih" is not correct, and it is an addition from the copyist in some copies. Sheikh Ahmad Shakir elaborated on weakening that Hadith and establishing that it has no basis. Musnad Imam Ahmad Ed: Ahmad Shakir Vol 1 p 329

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: If it is said: This is like what happened regarding the Adhan and the agreements of Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, it is a rejected matter because that was in the time of Revelation, so the confirmation was known by the confirmation of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, whose confirmation is inevitably from the confirmation of Revelation. So the outcome of the matter is that it is a Prophetic Sunnah whose path is confirmation. What "Al-Haralli" says regarding Allah's confirmation of the Companions' Ijtihad in arranging the Qur'an's Surahs is a matter existing according to his claim after the cessation of Revelation. So how was the knowledge of Allah's confirmation of what happened of the Companions' Ijtihad in this obtained? If "Al-Haralli" meant by his saying "by the Ijtihad of the Companions" their Ijtihad in arranging it by gathering it between the two covers of the Mushaf just as it was gathered in the chest of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, then the chests of his Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, it would be an undeniable matter to us... But that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, moved to the Supreme Companion while the Companions did not have the arrangement of the Wise Qur'an's Surahs in their chests according to the manner existing between the two covers of the Mushaf before us, this is the matter rejected by us. And when you follow "Al-Biqa'i" in his Tafsir, you find him stating in places of it what indicates clearly that the arrangement of Surahs is a manifestation of His miraculousness which is from its Revealer, Majestic is His Glory. In the opening of his interpretation of Surah "An-Nisa", he establishes that it is among the last of what was revealed, and mentions what Al-Bukhari narrated in the Virtues of the Qur'an in his Sahih that an Iraqi asked the Mother of the Believers "Aisha" the Truthful, may Allah be pleased with her, saying: "Which shroud is best? She said: Woe to you, and what harms you?"

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: "He said, O Mother of the Believers, show me your Mushaf. She said: Why? He said: So that I may compose the Qur'an upon it, for it is read uncomposed. She said: And what harms you which of it you read first. Indeed, the first of it to be revealed was a Surah from the Mufassal in which Paradise and Hell are mentioned, until when people returned to Islam, the Halal and Haram were revealed. If the first thing revealed was: Do not drink wine, they would have said: We will never leave wine. And if it was revealed: Do not commit adultery, they would have said: We will never leave adultery. It was revealed in Makkah upon Muhammad, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, while I was a playing girl: {But the Hour is their appointment, and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter} (Al-Qamar: 46). And Surah Al-Baqarah and An-Nisa were not revealed except while I was with him. He said: So she brought out the Mushaf for him, and dictated to him the verses of the Surah". "Al-Biqa'i" comments on this saying: "She meant by this, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Qur'an attained the highest rhetoric in its revelation conforming to what the conditions required according to the times, then it was arranged according to the highest aspects of rhetoric according to what the concepts of speech require, as we witness from this Book of wondrous example and far reach" (1). His comment is based on the fact that the Mother of the Believers pointed to two matters: First: Observing the condition of the Ummah at the time of revelation, so the revelation was like medicine for the maladies that occurred, so it was a revelation conforming to the condition of the Ummah and the reality of its movement in founding the Muslim Ummah. And the Other: Observing the condition of meaning and rhetorical miraculousness, so every verse descends in the context of its recitation in its position realizing for it the perfection of its rhetorical miraculousness by what it produces with what is before it and what is after it of meanings of guidance to the Straight Path. It was more appropriate for Al-Biqa'i to contemplate this report:

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: The Iraqi's question and his saying: "for it is read uncomposed" indicates clearly that the object of the request is standing upon the arrangement of Surahs and not the arrangement of verses, for the arrangement of verses, it has not been proven that a single Muslim dares to read the verses of the Holy Qur'an according to the order of their revelation as an act of worship, especially in prayer. But what can happen is that a Muslim reads a Surah before another Surah. And the answer of the Mother of the Believers, may Allah be pleased with her, indicates that she guided him that no harm, any harm that removes him from the station of obedience to Allah, Lord of the Worlds, or confuses for him the understanding of the Majority Faith Meaning, befalls him if he read a Surah before another Surah, even if the delayed one was prior in the order of revelation or the order of recitation. For the meanings taken from understanding the arrangement of Surahs are Ehsan meanings (excellence) rising above the Majority Faith meanings. So she said to him, may Allah be pleased with her: "And what harms you which of it you read first" meaning in the context of the arrangement of Surahs, not in the context of the arrangement of verses; because there is no doubt that if he read a verse before the one preceding it in the recitation sequence, a great harm would befall him in understanding the Majority Faith Meaning which is guidance for people. Then she said to him: "Indeed, the first of it to be revealed was a Surah from the Mufassal in which Paradise and Hell are mentioned, until when people returned to Islam, the Halal and Haram were revealed". This from her indicates clearly that the revelation was in accordance with what the methodology of psychological and spiritual education and culturing of the Ummah required, and taking the hands of people to what is easy for them, and escalating with them in the steps of obedience and closeness: "If the first thing revealed was: Do not drink wine, they would have said: We will never leave wine. And if it was revealed: Do not commit adultery, they would have said: We will never leave adultery."

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: So if this was with regard to the condition of the Ummah before people returned to Islam and it became established in their hearts, then the matter requires observing the requirement of another condition other than that observed by the Revelation Order. But a matter remains, which is that "The Iraqi" asked about the composition of Surahs, not the composition of verses in the Surah, and the end of the report says: "So she brought out the Mushaf for him, and dictated to him the verses of the Surah" and in a narration (verses of the Surahs). The apparent requirement is that the report says: So she brought out the Mushaf for him, and dictated to him the composition of the Surahs, and not the verses of the Surah, for the composition of the verses of the Surah is not the object of questioning. So what is the explanation for this? "Ibn Hajar" says in Fath al-Bari: "What appears to me is that this Iraqi was one of those who took by the reading of Ibn Mas'ud, and Ibn Mas'ud, when Uthman's Mushaf came to Kufa, did not agree to return from his reading nor to destroy his Mushaf... so the composition of his Mushaf was different from the composition of Uthman's Mushaf. There is no doubt that the composition of the Uthmani Mushaf is more appropriate than others, so for this reason the Iraqi stated that it is uncomposed. And this is all assuming the question occurred regarding the arrangement of Surahs. What indicates that is her saying to him: 'And what harms you which of it you read first'. And it is probable that he wanted the detailing of the verses of every Surah due to his saying at the end of the Hadith: So she dictated to him the verses of the Surahs' meaning the verses of every Surah, like saying Surah such-and-such for example has such-and-such verses, the first is such, the second... etc. And this goes back to the difference in the number of verses, and in it is a difference between the Madani, Shami, and Basri, and the Imams of Reciters took care to collect that and clarify the difference in it. And the first is more apparent. And it is probable that the question occurred regarding both matters, and Allah knows best" (1). What "Ibn Hajar" said is not sufficient or healing.

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: What appears to me regarding the action of "Mother of the Believers: Aisha", may Allah Almighty be pleased with her, in her dictating the verses of the Surah or Surahs is that it is from the type of the Wise Style tending to draw the attention of the questioner to what is more appropriate for him to ask about. As if she indicates to the Iraqi that what is more appropriate for the likes of you is to be concerned with the composition of the verses of the Surah, for you or your likes are in more need of that than disputing with others regarding the composition of Surahs. And so that the Iraqi does not take her action as a cause for arguing or fighting those who take by the arrangement of the Mushaf of "Ibn Mas'ud" or the Mushaf of "Ubayy bin Ka'b", standing in the face of the other with a copy of the Mother of the Believers' Mushaf in his hand, and she is who she is, so the dispute intensifies. That is from her wisdom in warding off Fitnah and closing the door of argumentation in what does not befit the Ummah to dispute about, while it was concerned at that time with what is more important than that. And it is good to listen in this to the word of "Abu Sulaiman Hamad Al-Khattabi (d. 388) on this issue: "The amount that needs to be mentioned here is that it should be known that the Qur'an was all collected in the chests of men during the life of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, and composed in this composition which we see and read. There occurred no advancing nor delaying nor addition nor decrease in it, except Surah 'Bara'ah' was among the last of what was revealed of the Qur'an, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, did not clarify its place in the composition until he left the world, so the Companions joined it with Al-Anfal. The clarification of that is in the report of 'Ibn Abbas' who said: 'I said to Uthman what made you proceed to Bara'ah which is from the Mi'un, and to Al-Anfal which is from the Mathani, so you joined them and did not make between them a line containing {In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful} and placed them in the Seven Long Ones? ... (The Hadith: At-Tirmidhi: Tafsir Hadith: 3086).

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: I said: This indicates to you that the collection was happening and the composition during the life of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, was present... It has been proven that four of the Companions collected the whole Qur'an in the time of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace... And they had partners in that among the Companions although these were more famous for it and more dedicated to caring for reading it... The collection of the Qur'an preceded the time of Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him. "Abu Bakr" only collected the Qur'an in sheets and papers and transferred it to what is between the two covers to publicize it and broadcast it in his time and to immortalize its drawing for future time. It was before that in shoulder blades, patches of leather, palm stalks, white stones, and the like of what Arabs used to write in as vessels. It is likely that the cause for the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, leaving the collection of the Qur'an in one Mushaf as those after him from the Companions did is that Abrogation (Naskh) used to occur on what was revealed of it, so something would be lifted after something from its recitation just as some of its rulings were lifted...

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: For if it had been compiled between the two covers in its entirety, and riders traveled with it, and hands circulated it in the regions and lands, and then some of it was abrogated and its recitation lifted, that would have led to difference in the matter of religion and the existence of addition and subtraction in it. It would have almost caused the undoing of the Call (Da'wah), the division of the word, and atheists finding a way to attack it and cast doubt upon it. So Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, kept it in the state in which it was revealed—dispersed in its vessels—and protected it from alteration and change until the religion was sealed by the death of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace. Then He guided his Rightly Guided Caliphs to collect it between the two covers when it was needed, and facilitated for them its complete enumeration by agreement from the dictation of the Companions and consensus of their opinions, when there remained no expectation of abrogation from it, nor anything of its rulings subject to revision" (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) - A'lam al-Hadith fi Sharh Sahih al-Bukhari by Abu Sulaiman Al-Khattabi: Vol 3, pp 1852-1858 - Ed: Muhammad Sa'd Al Saud - Pub: Umm Al-Qura University - 1409 AH.

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: This indicates from Abu Sulaiman Al-Khattabi that the collection of the Holy Qur'an in the hearts (minds), with its verses and surahs arranged, was established during the era of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace. It explains the reason for the delay in collecting it in that manner between the two covers of a Mushaf (written copy), and the reason the Companions undertook making its collection in the hearts during the time of Prophethood joined by its collection between two covers. Thus, the two collections served as documentation and verification, for fear that the first collection might vanish with the passing of the hearts (people) who collected it, when killing intensified against many of them during Jihad in the path of Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted. What the Companions did regarding the collection was no more than transcribing the collection existing in the hearts to be between the two covers of a Mushaf. This is similar to the scribes who copy a book from the master copy created, arranged, and composed by the book's author in the world of scholars; the scribe does nothing but transfer it from the master copy written by its author exactly as it is to other multiple copies. However, the master copy here regarding the Holy Qur'an was the hearts preserved by faith, and that which was within them of the Holy Qur'an was preserved by the protection of its Revealer, Glory be to Him and Exalted, upon His servant and Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace: {Indeed, it is We who sent down the Dhikr and indeed, We will be its guardian} (Al-Hijr: 9).

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: When you look at the rhetoric of this majestic verse, you do not find it consisting of a single sentence in which the subject is informed about by two predicates, the second conjoined to the first. Rather, it consists of two sentences, the second conjoined to the first. Each is built upon the emphasized subject indicated by the Royal 'We' (Inna - Indeed We), with its emphasis in the first [sentence]—which informs about Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, exclusively sending it down—by His saying (Nahnu - We), unlike the second [sentence] which informs about Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, specifically restricting His preservation to the Wise Dhikr (Quran). In each, there is exclusivity (Ikhtisas): In the first, He restricted the revelation to Himself, so no one else sent down the Holy Qur'an; this is restricting the Attribute to the Entity: restricting the revelation of the Holy Qur'an to Him, Glory be to Him and Exalted. In the other, He restricted His preservation, Exalted be He, to the Holy Qur'an; meaning, We did not guarantee the preservation of any book We sent down from the heavenly books except the preservation of the Wise Dhikr. That is, the restriction of His preservation is to its occurrence upon the Holy Qur'an to the exclusion of others. This follows the method of "I listened to no one but Muhammad"; it is restricting the Entity to the Attribute. Thus, two matters gathered for the Holy Qur'an: First, that no one sent it down except Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted. Second, that it is specifically singled out for Allah's preservation, Glory be to Him and Exalted, unlike other heavenly books preceding it which were afflicted with distortion at the hands of the followers of those to whom they were revealed.

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: In this is an indication of the great disparity between the state of the Companions and followers of the Prophet, our Master Muhammad, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, regarding the Holy Qur'an revealed to their Prophet, and the state of the followers of the [previous] Prophets and Messengers and their stance towards the Books revealed to them. The Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, were instruments for confirming the preservation of that Book and its infallibility from distortion, alteration, addition, and subtraction. Whereas the nation of previous Prophets was a cause for distortion, alteration, and change through addition and subtraction. So look at the favor of Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, upon the followers of His beloved Muhammad, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace. This confirms the statement that the preservation of the Holy Qur'an from the slightest change by advancing or delaying a verse or a surah is indeed from Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, and that the favor Allah conducted at the hands of the Companions of His servant, Prophet, and Messenger, our Master Muhammad, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, was represented in making them instruments to manifest this preservation in another vessel joined to the previous vessel: preservation between the two covers [of the Mushaf] added to preservation in the hearts. The summary of the matter in this is: The arrangement of the Surahs between the two covers of the Mushaf in the manner that is before us, and which will remain so until the Hour, is exactly what existed in the heart of the Prophet, our Master Muhammad, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, as revelation from Allah Almighty, and in the hearts of his Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, receiving it from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and not by Ijtihad (independent reasoning). And that within this arrangement are signs of rhetorical miraculousness equal to what is in the composition of its verses in a single Surah, and even what is in the composition of the words of a single verse of great, majestic rhetorical miraculousness.

book_title: Imam Al-Biqa'i and His Methodology in Interpreting the Rhetoric of the Qur'an
text: If this is what you heard from the opinion of "Abu Sulaiman Al-Khattabi," then the author of the book "Al-Mabani li Nazm al-Ma'ani"—who is one of the scholars of the fourth and fifth centuries—goes in the introduction of his book in the third chapter to state that the Holy Qur'an, in the arrangement before us between the two covers of the Mushaf, is the same as that which is in the Preserved Tablet (Al-Lawh Al-Mahfuz), saying: "As for the evidence that it is in the Preserved Tablet in this arrangement which is in our hands, and that He Almighty sent it down as a whole to the lowest heaven on the Night of Decree, then parts of it were sent down one after another according to need, it is the saying of Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted: {Indeed, upon Us is its collection and its recitation. * So when We have recited it, then follow its recitation. * Then upon Us is its clarification} (Al-Qiyamah: 17-19). This is the strongest evidence that Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, took charge of its revelation, collection, and ordering, and sent it down upon the Chosen One, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, on the tongue of Gabriel, peace be upon him, and protected him from oversight, error, and alteration in it" (1). Then he says: "And indicated by the reports narrated from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, regarding naming the Surah 'Al-Hamdu lillahi Rabb al-'Alamin' as the Opening of the Book (Fatihat al-Kitab). Were it not that he, may Allah bless him and his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, commanded the Companions to arrange this order by the command of 'Gabriel', peace be upon him, from 'Allah', Mighty and Majestic, his naming of this Surah as 'Opening of the Book' would have had no meaning, since it is established by consensus that this Surah is not the opening of the Qur'an's surahs in revelation. Thus, it is proven that it is its opening in order, arrangement, and speech" (2). The Fourth Feature: Returning the end of the Holy Qur'an to its beginning.
